com.algolia.instantsearch.ui

Class InstantSearchHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.algolia.instantsearch.ui.InstantSearchHelper

  • public class InstantSearchHelper
extends Object
    Uses the Searcher to react to changes in your application's interface, like when your user types a new query or interacts with Widgets. You can either use it with a single widget which will receive incoming results, or with several that will interact together in the same activity.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DELAY_PROGRESSBAR_NO_ANIMATIONS
      Delay before displaying progressbar when the current android API does not support animations.

    • Field Detail

      • DELAY_PROGRESSBAR_NO_ANIMATIONS

        public static final int DELAY_PROGRESSBAR_NO_ANIMATIONS
        Delay before displaying progressbar when the current android API does not support animations. (API < 14)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • InstantSearchHelper

        public InstantSearchHelper(@NonNull
                           Activity activity,
                           @NonNull
                           Searcher searcher)
        Create and initialize the helper, then link it to the given Activity.
        Parameters:
        activity - an Activity containing at least one AlgoliaWidget to update with incoming results.
        searcher - the Searcher to use with this activity.

      • InstantSearchHelper

        public InstantSearchHelper(@NonNull
                           Activity activity,
                           @NonNull
                           Menu menu,
                           @IdRes
                           int menuItemId,
                           @NonNull
                           Searcher searcher)
        Create and initialize the helper, then link it to the given Activity and Menu's searchView.
        Parameters:
        activity - an Activity containing at least one AlgoliaWidget to update with incoming results.
        menu - the Menu which contains your SearchView.
        menuItemId - the SearchView item's id in your Menu.
        searcher - the Searcher to use with this activity.

      • InstantSearchHelper

        public InstantSearchHelper(@NonNull
                           AlgoliaWidget widget,
                           @NonNull
                           Searcher searcher)
        Create and initialize the helper, then link it to the given widget.
        Parameters:
        widget - an AlgoliaWidget to update with incoming results.
        searcher - the Searcher to use with this AlgoliaWidget.

      • search

        public void search()
        Start a new search with the searchView's text.

      • search

        public void search(@NonNull
                   Intent intent)
        Start a search if the given intent is an ACTION_SEARCH intent.
        Parameters:
        intent - an Intent that may contain a search query.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the search interface and state via Searcher.reset() and AlgoliaWidget.onReset().

      • registerSearchView

        public void registerSearchView(@NonNull
                               Activity activity,
                               @NonNull
                               Menu menu,
                               int id)
        Register the Search Widget of an Activity's Menu to fire queries on text change.
        Parameters:
        activity - The searchable Activity, see SearchableInfo.
        menu - The Menu that contains a search item.
        id - The identifier of the menu's search item.

      • registerSearchView

        public void registerSearchView(@NonNull
                               Activity activity,
                               @NonNull
                               SearchView searchView)
        Registers a SearchView to fire queries on text change.
        Parameters:
        activity - The searchable activity, see SearchableInfo.
        searchView - a SearchView where the query text will be picked up from.

      • registerSearchView

        public void registerSearchView(@NonNull
                               Activity activity,
                               @NonNull
                               SearchView searchView)
        Registers a SearchView to fire queries on text change.
        Parameters:
        activity - The searchable activity, see SearchableInfo.
        searchView - a SearchView where the query text will be picked up from.

        public void initSearchFrom(@NonNull
                           Activity activity)
        Initialize search from the given activity according to its searchable info.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity with a SearchView identified as @+id/searchBox.

      • enableProgressBar

        public void enableProgressBar(int delay)
        Enable the display of a spinning progressBar in the SearchView when waiting for results.
        Parameters:
        delay - a delay to wait between firing a request and displaying the indicator.

      • enableProgressBar

        public void enableProgressBar()
        Enable the display of a ProgressBar in the SearchView when waiting for results.

      • disableProgressBar

        public void disableProgressBar()
        Disable the ProgressBar, removing it if it is already displayed.

      • getItemLayoutId

        public static int getItemLayoutId()
        Get the IdRes of the item layout registered by a Hits widget. This method should only be used by the library's internals.
        Returns:
        the registered item layout id, if any.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no item layout was registered.

      • setSearchOnEmptyString

        public void setSearchOnEmptyString(boolean searchOnEmptyString)
        Enable or disable the sending of a search request when the SearchView becomes empty (defaults to true).
        Parameters:
        searchOnEmptyString - if true, a request will be fired.

        public boolean searchOnEmptyString()
